Experience New Product Planner Intel Corporation November 2008  – Present (6 years 10 months) Intel architecture CPU New Product Planning supports all of Intel CPU microprocessors including desktop, server, mobile and Low Power applications. NPPs play a key role in the product development teams (PDT) for these products from early design to product launch. In this position, I am will be responsible for the supply chain coordination and startup activities for an Intel CPU product line from initial prototype production through introduction to high volume manufacturing. Supply Chain Specialist The Boeing Company July 2007  –  November 2008  (1 year 5 months) In this position I work at the organizational level to administer such product support processes as, integrated support plans, post-production support plans, and fielding plans. Investigate and develop solutions to such problems as support planning and analysis; estimating; scheduling; and tracking repair, overhaul, lease, and exchange activities. Participate in the analysis, definition, and implementation of new and revised support systems, processes, and policies. Manufacturing Technicial Intel Corporation July 2005  –  July 2007  (2 years 1 month) I work at the Assembly and Test Development facility and am responsible for processing material according to complex, but documented procedures, collecting and entering data, monitoring the operations, and maintaining process and metrology equipment.  
-Identified an issue with epoxy material being wasted on each shift. Conducted an investigation that revealed over $400K of material being thrown away per year. Developed a presentation with a proposal for waste reduction implementation, which incorporated alternative cost structures with identified risks and gaps. Based on these efforts, manufacturing is now partnering with finance to intercept the 1268 platform in an effort to implement the proposed cost reductions that will save an estimated $1.8M over 5 years. 
-Epoxy 5S team. Works with his peers to drive the fundamentals of 5S, and role model the activities and mindset in the area. Work to insure the area is in a consistent state of order and compliant with all 5S expectations Warehouse Supervisor BAX Global SCM February 2002  –  July 2005  (3 years 6 months) As Warehouse Supervisor I was responsible for 23 direct reports across all shifts in a 24x7 operation. I managed the Inventory Control and Stockroom operations and was responsible for the accuracy of the inventory and adherence to my company’s Service Level Agreements with Intel. Summary An experienced supply chain professional with many years in supply chain management with companies that range from high tech to forestry/agriculture to consumer products. I have managed both retail and commercial systems. My experience includes all engineering and technical aspects of products, low cost country sourcing, centralized and global supply chain development. 
Specialties: Supply chain management, sourcing, negotiations, out/in sourcing, supplier quality, purchasing, contracts, international business, logistics, compliance.
